intro: Oenothera howardii, commonly known as the Howard's evening primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves are adapted to arid environments. Oenothera howardii is also noted for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, which contribute to its ecological resilience.
